metadata.title: CVE-2021-3933 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An integer overflow could occur when OpenEXR processes a crafted file onsystems where size_t < 64 bits. This could cause an invalid bytesPerLineand maxBytesPerLine value, which could lead to problems with applicationstability or lead to other attack paths.

criterions.comment: openexr: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ilmbase: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
